result.execSummary:
The defendant Chad A Corrao was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

  If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

timeConds.notes:
--serve 6 months in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber/Work-release privileges for employment & treatment; to commence 2/19/16 no later than 7:00 pm

Sentence may transfer to Waukesha County as long as electronic monitoring or home detention is not utilized

--To submit DNA Sample

 Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in his/her system.  Non-compliance will result in loss of Huber/work-release privileges without further process.
****Per 4/21/17 Order Court orders 30 days condition time as a condition of probation to be served in the Jefferson County Jail****

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 2:26 pm [Clerk SH]
Defendant Chad A Corrao in court with Attorney Laura Michelle Habush. ADA Brookellen Teuber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Victim Rights Compliance Verified; Atty Habush submits treatment information along with plea paperwork

Constitutional rights given; plea of "Guilty" entered; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.

Court withholds sentence, places Defendant on Probation for 3 years, with conditions as listed on the criminal case settlement form, which include:
--AODA Assessment & Follow Through with recommended treatment, per Agent
--Any other assessment, treatment or counseling per Agent
--Random drug and/or alcohol screening (at least 1x per month upon release from jail for the first 6 months; thereafter, per agent)
--Obtain/maintain employment and/or education program, per Agent
--No possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--No possession of hypodermic needles unless medically necessary and approved by Agent
--No contact with Eric Werther
--Costs, fees, assessments and surcharges
--No contact with any known drug offender except for treatment purposes as deemed appropriate per agent
--Reimburse buy money reimbursement
--To submit DNA Sample
Sentence may transfer to Waukesha County as long as electronic monitoring or home detention is not utilized

No DL suspension

Court AMENDS criminal case settlement as follows:
--serve 6 months in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber/Work-release privileges for employment & treatment; to commence 2/19/
16 no later than 7:00 pm

Days credit for time already served: 0 days
Felony Firearm/Voting Prohibitions Warnings Form Given
Recess: 3:08 pm
Courts response to 12-18-15 letter from Attorney Habush
Letter from Attorney Habush ref scheduling

Case called at 9:34am [mo]
Defendant Chad A Corrao in court with Attorney Laura Michelle Habush.   ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Shock verifies victim rights compliance

Atty. Habush indicates that she had filed a Motion for Discovery to the State, she has received most of the Discovery from the State, including a recording of very poor quality in which she requests additional time to seek a better copy, if there is such. Atty. Habush indicates she is not in receipt of lab results and needs to speak within assigned prosecutor.

The Court schedules this case for FSSC and Jury Trial
The Court and Counsel discuss scheduling. 
The Court directs the State to submit items that need testing to the Crime Lab by close of business on  11/6/15; if the items are already at the Crime Lab the Court directs the State communicate with lab the currently scheduled trial date and if an analyst has not yet been assigned to assign one that is available on the scheduled trial date.
The Court distributes its scheduling order.

recess: 9:42am

NEXT: (1)FSSC  on 2/1/2016 at 2:00pm (2)Jury Trial on 2/18/2016 at 8:30am

Case called at 10:10am [mo]
Defendant Chad A Corrao in court with Attorney Laura Michelle Habush.   ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Shock verifies victim rights compliance.

Mr. Corrao waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--the charges and maximum penalties are recited
--pleas of "not guilty" entered
No demand for speedy trial made at this time

The Court and Counsel discuss scheduling
recess: 10:19am

NEXT: Status Conference on 11/3/15 at 9:30am

[MK] case called at 1:50pm. 
Defendant Chad A Corrao in court with Attorney Laura M Habush.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
On agreement of counsel, the Court continues the Bond. 
Preliminary Hearing time limits are waived by both parties.
The Court renews its disclosure that in the Court's former capacity as Jefferson County District Attorney, attorneys that then-DA Wambach supervised did prosecute Mr. Corrao.  The Court does not feel that any disqualification or recusal is needed.
The Court directs Mr. Corrao to go to the Sheriff's Department today to check in and verify that booking has occurred and that the information is being submitted by JCSO to the Court.  
recess 1:55pm.

NEXT:   (1) Pretrial Conference on 8/19/15 at 2:40pm (2) Status Conference on 9/8/15 at 10:00am
Conflict Review Worksheet - No Conflict Found
Scheduling Notice; Your Right to Legal Representation in a Criminal or Criminal Traffic Case

Case called at 3:12 pm [Clerk SH]
Defendant Chad A Corrao in court. ADA Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Service of Complaint admitted; DOB & address confirmed accurate; charge/penalties recited; reading waived
Court finds probable cause within the complaint to support Count #1
Court reviews conflict review worksheet; finds no conflict or need to recuse or disqualiffy & endorses worksheet
Mr. Corrao confirms that the was present when the Court reviewed right to counsel & constructive waiver of counsel warnings
Mr. Corrao informs the Court that he would like counsel

Court requires a $5000 signature bond, with conditions:
-No possession of hypodermic needles or syringes without a documented medical need
-Booking at JCSD 
Recess: 3:19 pm 

NEXT: (1) Schedule Adjourned Initial Appearance 7/21/15 at 2:00 pm  - Send notices
